title: Drawing, "Stage Design: Palace Architecture", 1750–99
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor; ruled border in black ink on paper
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Design for a stage set.  View of palace facade consisting of circular arcade in the foreground, surmounted by arcades in the back, niches with fountains. Ruled and curved border at the top.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Stage Design: Palace Architecture", 1750–99.
1750–99. Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor; ruled border in black ink on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-40.
